}} 'Reactor' is a raster video arcade game released in 1982 by Gottlieb. The
object of the game is to cool down the reactor core without being hurled by
magnetism and repulsion by enemy swarms of nuclear particles. It was better
known for its explosive and ground thumping sound, usually placed near the front
of the arcade to attract gamers.
